attributes.action: Represent remain voters equally within new government leadership framework
attributes.background: 48% of the voting public wanted to remain in the EU, it is unrepresentative and undemocratic that the leaders of our government should stand for a UK polar opposite to what we stand for. Significant Remain Tory representatives should have key roles in the upcoming changes within cabinet.
attributes.additional_details: Young members of voting demographic feel disenfranchised and as though they have unfairly lost out on something they believed in. 48% of the public who voted wish to remain in the EU and do not want a far right, nationalist government. In order for this proportion of the population to feel represented and valued as voters and citizens, those wishing to remain need to be represented equally by senior remain politicians in the new government framework after Cameron's formal resignation.

attributes.action: Make  winning majority vote in referendum (such as EU vote) need majority of 10%
attributes.background: Today's EU referendum results show that the country is very much in a 50/50 split with only approximately 4%  difference.  Since referendum are there for major countrywide decisions (rather than a 5 year government) a more decisive majority is needed.

attributes.action: Manchester and London to join Scotland and Stay in the EU
attributes.background:
In the referendum on EU membership Manchester voted to remain by 60.4%. London voted to remain at nearly 80% in some boroughs. Scotland also voted to remain.
As people of these areas we do not wish to leave the EU. 
We wish to join Scotland, declare independence from UK and remain part of the EU.

attributes.action: Stop closure of Lincoln Limb Clinic Services
attributes.background: From September 2016, Lincoln Limb Clinic will be closed and all appointments will be at Nottingham City Hospital. Patients are expected to travel up to a 161.4 mile round trip for an appointment. This is WRONG and will cause unnecessary toll on the young and older patients.
attributes.additional_details: This planned action is quoted as 'being in the interest of providing a better service' but in reality, no-one who uses Lincoln Clinic have complained about the service they receive. This is just another money saving measure, removing a service NHS Management know that amputees need, thus forcing us to accept the changes....They have us over a barrel. Please sign this petition and help us to try and keep our service local for the benefit of patients, not the 'bean counters' Thankyou

attributes.action: Deploy warships in the English Channel to stop and deter illegal migrants.
attributes.background: Over the past few weeks there have been known several incidents of illegal migrants trying to cross the English Channel to get in the UK. So far only one of the attempted crossings have been successful but it is inevitable that more will get into the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
For too long, the UK has been lenient when it comes to illegals trying to get into our nation and we must set an example to defend ourselves from possible terrorists posing as migrants (as seen during the Cologne and Paris attacks). And also to prevent further actual refugees from risking their lives trying to get into the UK.

I ask the Government to deploy warships into the English Channel to; stop and turn around illegals, deter further illegals from risking their lives in the effort to get into the UK, and if necessary use lethal force to defend British waters.

attributes.action: Make the government increase funds to support youth mental health.
attributes.background:
Due to national bed shortages in mental health units, many young people have been forced to move over 200 miles away from home, leaving loved ones behind.

0.6% of the NHS budget goes into helping young people with mental health, this is not enough.

attributes.action: Stop councils forcing homeless tenants to stay past a section 21
attributes.background:
Local housing authorities are forcing private tenants to stay after the end date of a section 21, and making them wait until bailiff evictions. The tenant is responsible for the court and bailiff costs.
If the tenant does not stay, they are deemed intentionally homeless and refused help.
attributes.additional_details: Both local councils and shelter England advice the tenant to stay after the end of the section 21 date. Why should the tenant be liable for cost when following the councils guidance? Why should landlords have to take tenants to court to get their properties back.? Why are councils using a form of blackmail to get tenants to do what they want?

attributes.action: Stop the winding down of mobile Blood Donor Units nationally
attributes.background: Which is believed to be policy by end of 2016
attributes.additional_details: Blood is given freely and is a needed resource for our medical services, if this policy goes ahead I am sure that the numbers of donors will reduce dramatically, which could effect many lives

attributes.action: Require the Government to immediately abolish tuition fees.
attributes.background: The current rate of interest charged by the Student Loan Company is currently eight times the current rate of inflation. Quite simply, the status quo will stifle this country's future prosperity by strangling our talent at birth.

attributes.action: Make solar renewable energy a government-led initiative
attributes.background: While it has been often argued that the United Kingdom is a leader in the field of renewable energy, this has primarily been accomplished by the actions of private British businesses and not the actions of the government. It is most certainly time for the government to take its place in the sun.
attributes.additional_details: It is our goal, as it should be the goal of every person both of and on these islands and elsewhere on this planet, to protect it for future generations. There is no doubt in the minds of scientists that a future including humans must be a future of renewable and clean energy. We therefore recommend that the government require all of its properties, and those owned by its representatives of the people of both the upper and lower chambers, to, within a period of five years, possess solar panels.

attributes.action: Stop calling the new minimum wage the 'National Living Wage'.
attributes.background: The Living Wage Foundation defines the living wage as £8.25 per hour for the UK as a whole, or £9.40 in London.  While we are glad that the minimum wage has been increased to £7.20, this is not the living wage.  As such, it should be called the Minimum Wage, NOT the 'National Living Wage'.

attributes.action: Ban door-to-door fundraising by large charities (so called 'doorstep chuggers')
attributes.background: This method of fundraising can be intrusive and where high pressure tactics are used by the fundraisers (who may in cases be remunerated based on the level of donation commitments they secure), can potentially put elderly or vulnerable persons in a position where they are taken advantage of.
attributes.additional_details: Our view is that attempts to regulate this form of fundraising activity seem ineffective and as such our petition is for an outright ban to make the position clearer on what is and is not allowed.

attributes.action: Prevent over 65's from being allowed to vote in the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
The older generations are sacrificing the future of the younger population by voting out of the EU due to reminicing on the past.
The final decision has little or no effect on the ageing portion of the population, however it is the young people who will be effected the most as job prospects change.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that it should be the people who the decision effects the most making the choice. Regardless of the outcome, it is the young peoples lives which will change the most. 3 million jobs are directly linked with the EU, with many many more being indirectly linked to EU trade. That makes at least 3 million people who's lives could change depending on the result. Further more, the outcome has no effect on pensions. This means that the household income of the elderly is likely to remain the same whatever the outcome.

attributes.action: Introduce laws to prevent companies using pension funds for any other purpose
attributes.background: Companies are continually reporting a black hole in pension funds also when companies go bust the pension fund is empty.

attributes.action: Change the tax system so student loan repayments are taken before income tax.
attributes.background: Most students can not use their income tax allowance whilst studying at university and rely on borrowing money from the students loan company to cover living expenses. Therefore, repayments of this student debt should be exempt from income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
These changes would bring the following benefits:

1. Earlier repayment and reduced pressure of student debt
2. A fairer systems for those starting out in life
3. Additional encouragement for further education

attributes.action: Make polygamy a specific criminal offence
attributes.background: Bigamy is a criminal offence in the UK and it therefor makes no sense for polygamy not to be a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Briefing Paper number 05051 dated 6th January 2016.

attributes.action: Change the title of the Ministry of Defence to the Ministry of Attack
attributes.background: I believe the current title is misleading and the proposed title is much more appropriate given the general nature of it's business.
attributes.additional_details:
The Ministry Of Defence was formally established in 1964, since which time it has overseen 12 military engagements. Out of these 12, UK borders have been threatened on only 2 occasions at most (The Falklands War and The Troubles). On the remaining 10 occasions, the Armed Forces were operating within another nations borders. 

The Oxford dictionary defines 'attack' as: 

(verb)

Take aggressive military action against (a place or enemy forces) with weapons or armed force.

attributes.action: Stop the cuts to the funding of Sharnbrook Upper School Sixth Form
attributes.background: Cuts to Sharnbrook Sixth form are meaning that the school is having to cut around 18 subjects including Spanish, German, a number of arts subjects Electronics, Computing and Geology. We believe that this is fundamentally wrong as it will negatively impact students and thus needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the governments cuts to the schools funding is going to severely impact the education that students can receive at Sharnbrook. They are unfair cuts and make the work being done at the school to help and nurture students to fill their full potentials even more challanging than it already is in this education system that we are part of. 
Therefore we are calling for the cuts to Sharnbrook to be stopped so the school can continue to provide their award winning A-level provisions.

attributes.action: Allow British citizens to offer rooms in their homes to refugees, for free
attributes.background: Many people would willingly give up space in their home for free to a refugee or a refugee family. The British government should start a scheme to encourage people to do this.
attributes.additional_details: There are 20 million refugees in the world, including 5 million from Syria. The plight of "displaced people" is not new. Most prolonged wars cause many people to flee their homes - or from the ruins of their homes. Many live in overcrowded conditions with relatives. Many don't have that option, fleeing across borders to a life of uncertainty, often living in camps or shanty towns. There is a long tradition of citizens giving up space in their homes to house refugees. Publicly encourage this.

attributes.action: Equalise public spending per capita throughout the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland get higher payments per capita than England. This is unreasonable. All countries in the UK should receive the same amount per capita.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014/15, public spending per capita in the UK as a whole was £8,913. In England, it was £8,638 (3% below the UK average). This compares with:
• Scotland: £10,374 (16% above the UK average – 20% higher than England)
• Wales: £9,904 (11% above the UK average – 14.7% higher than England)
• Northern Ireland £11,106 (25% above the UK average – 28.6% higher than England).
(Data source: House of Commons Briefing Paper Number 04300, 8 March 2015)

attributes.action: Call on the government to publicly confirm support for strong encryption.
attributes.background: The government should not erode the security of our devices or applications, pressure companies to keep and allow government access to our data, mandate implementation of vulnerabilities or backdoors into products or have disproportionate access to the keys to  our private data.
attributes.additional_details:
The public demands privacy, security, and integrity for their communications and devices. As a public, we should be confident that the services we use haven’t been weakened or compromised by government mandate or pressure. No legislation or private agreement with the government should undermine our rights.

Weakening encryption weakens the entire Internet. Endorse strong encryption and encourage other world governments to do the same.

attributes.action: An MP cannot invest in or profit from tax avoidance schemes/entities.
attributes.background: David Cameron and most likely others have involvement with entities that exist to avoid contributing to taxation. They either directly benefit from this in avoiding tax for themselves or for others, either way it is a gross abuse of the position of MP to be involved in avoiding taxation.
attributes.additional_details: A law could be created that barred anyone from sitting in the commons and the lords who has had any interest in tax avoidance. If it was found, like in the prime ministers case, that they had done so as an MP (or before) they should be discharged from their position.

attributes.action: NHS to employ more Psychiatrists so patients are able to have a proper diagnosis
attributes.background: How is someone able to get better without a proper diagnosis? I believe if I had been diagnosed earlier then I would be now employed and become a productive member of society.
attributes.additional_details:
My doctor and I have continually requested a consultation with the NHS for an assessment with a psychiatrist for a duration of three years.  
The government is committed to mental health care mainly targeting dementia and teenagers.  What I propose covers everyone, all genders, races and financial backgrounds.  
The treatment I have received had really upset me and frustrated my GP, friends and family who are also affected by the condition I have. Everyone should have the right to a proper diagnosis and so the required treatment can be undertaken.

attributes.action: Parliament to legislate to require employers to reply to all job applications
attributes.background: Increasingly unsuccessful candidates never receive a notification that their application has been unsuccessful which is unacceptable. Looking for a job is stressful and employers should be sensitive to this and  reply to all applicants. It is just common courtesy

attributes.action: Scrap cash benefits and bring in 'Welfare Vouchers' that are monetary value.
attributes.background: Introduce a welfare voucher for individuals, couples and families alike which will replace the benefits that they are on. No one will be out of pocket as they will get exactly the same amount of monetary value, based on their circumstances
attributes.additional_details: The government could work in partnership with all the major retailers like ASDA, Sainsbury’s, Morrison’s, Tesco etc. Supermarkets can claim the money back from their local authority, it will be similar to the healthy start vouchers, but on a bigger scale.  Help stop wasting tax payers money, by people spending our tax money on scratchcards alcohol and cigarettes. Buying stuff they actually need. The welfare voucher will restrict by not being able to buy scratchcards with them and limit how much cigarettes and alcohol they can buy with them as well.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for public institutions to recycle
attributes.background: Most public institutions, including some sectors of the NHS and many school and colleges across the UK don't recycle. This can lead to much paper and plastic waste, we normally recycle at home, being taken to landfill instead.
attributes.additional_details: In the average school, 500 plastic bottles are used a day, ending in landfill. Alongside this is the countless sheets of paper and card thrown away by schools. The NHS similarly has little are no recycling bins for public use. This is replicated in parks and towns across the country, with all the plastic and paper waste we use when in public going to landfill, when it could, and should, be recycled.

attributes.action: Make openly threatening the stability of UK society in public a criminal offence
attributes.background: Being British is about respect and tolerance; public use of hateful language, threats, actions and gestures aimed against UK society and values is becoming too common; it can be seen in media almost daily around the UK and is getting far worse. This causes fear and division and should be illegal.

attributes.action: Adjust financial exemption on Fiancé and Spouse visas to include ESA
attributes.background: I am currently in receipt of ESA and I am forbidden to marry my Russian fiancé, or to bring her over if we manage to wed abroad, because I do not meet financial restrictions imposed by the Home Office. My disability truly hinders my ability to meet the demands.
attributes.additional_details:
Fiancé and Spouse visas require the sponsor, the British partner, to either earn 18.6k or have 62.5k in savings of more than six months. If in receipt of a disability allowance the sponsor is exempt from these restrictions, and although ESA is considered a disability allowance, it is not considered so by the Home Office who do not feel it justifies exemption. 

Yet another example of inequalities imposed upon the disabled people of Britain.

https://www.gov.uk/browse/benefits/disability

attributes.action: Protect in law the right to have your birthday off work.
attributes.background: Birthdays only come once a year and often in the business of work home life imbalance,  special occasions which should be enjoyed and embraced by families are kicked to the curb!

attributes.action: Remove the Value Added Tax charged on toilet rolls and make them VAT Exempt.
attributes.background: Value Added Tax is currently charged by HM Treasury on the sale of toilet rolls at the rate of 20%. I believe that this should be abolished as they are not "non-essential, luxury items" and are an essential item as are female hygeine products which are rated at 5%.

attributes.action: Vaccinate all children against the ACWY strain of meningitis
attributes.background: My son contracted the Men W strain of meningococcal septacimia at age 20 months in April 2015, he was extremely poorly and got turned away from 3 health professionals as having a virus until I went by my cut instinct and took him to the children's hospital. He had no rash and we almost lost him.
attributes.additional_details:
Cases of meningitis and septicaemia due to Men W have been increasing in England, from 22 cases in 2009 to 117 in 2014. The increase seems to be speeding up in 2015, caused by an aggressive strain of the bug. But it's fatal in about 1 in 10 cases and can lead to long-term health problems.
Men W infections are particularly severe and usually need to be treated in intensive care. They have a higher death rate than the more common Men C and Men B strains.

attributes.action: Cap Benefits for a maximum of 3 kids starting from the day of implementation.
attributes.background: Lets deter people from having kids for benefit reasons. By capping benefits at three kids we can reduce the benefit bill, stop people from taking advantage of the system.

attributes.action: End the supply of alcoholic drinks to MP's / Peers in the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.background:
MP's and Peers are able to purchase alcoholic drinks at a subsidized price at bars in the palace of Westminster costing the tax payer over £4million per year.
As a place of work Westminster should be kept dry with provision of food and soft drinks only. our MPs should vote with a clear head.

attributes.action: Impose a ban on leaving your engine running whilst your vehicle is parked.
attributes.background: 9000 people a year in London are killed annually by pollution, about 4million worldwide and that number is rising.
attributes.additional_details:
People often sit in their cars for many minutes with the engine on, I suppose so they can keep the heating on too, or the radio, without running down the battery.
It should be standard to keep a blanket in your car for such occurrences. Parking outside someone's house and belching poison into the occupant's atmosphere should be considered akin to grievous bodily harm.

attributes.action: KEEP current tax allowances on the 25% lump sum and contributions for pensions
attributes.background:
Currently pension contributions are paid from your income BEFORE it is taxed.  And when you take your pension, you can take 25% of it tax free. 
The chancellor is considering changing this IN THE16th MARCH BUDGET so that the 25% is taxed AND tax is taken BEFORE you contribute into your pension.
attributes.additional_details:
If this is implemented your contributions into a pension may be taxed BEFORE you contribute thus reducing how much you can save or increasing the tax on your income.
Similarly the entire pot may be taxed when you take it! 
Pension pots take years to accrue and changes can be devastating especially to people near retirement.
Even if you have taken your pension this would affect your family and friends.
We need to tell the chancellor to STOP MESSING WITH PEOPLES PENSIONS.

attributes.action: Stop Landlords refusing DSS
attributes.background:
I see a lot of people struggling to get a flat, or house, due to the Landlord refusing to accept DSS. It does not matter whether the Landlord knows the circumstances as to why DSS is required!

Stop the discrimination - Stop allowing Landlords the right to refuse DSS claimants as tenants!

attributes.action: To implement a minimum wage for people under the age of 16.
attributes.background: This is part of a GCSE Citizenship campaign that is to bring about change in society. We are a group of 14 and 15 year olds that feel the need to make a change. This campaign is worth supporting because it is to bring about equality and make a change in society.

attributes.action: Make all cyclists responsible for their actions on public roads!
attributes.background:
Why isn't there any compulsory training for cyclists, why isn't there a way of identifying a cyclist?

We want dangerous cyclists off the road!

Help us promote safe cycling!
attributes.additional_details:
Some of these links will explain what we are trying to deal with:

www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3131256/Has-got-death-wish-Incredible-dashcam-footage-shows-idiot-cyclist-riding-no-hands-busy-London-streets-s-busy-TEXTING.html 

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/fatal-crashes-are-cyclists-fault-says-boris-7786179.html 

www.leicestermercury.co.uk/Cyclists-fault/story-27759929-detail/story.html

attributes.action: Abolish PFI contracts in the NHS
attributes.background: The nhs is being privatised and 7% goes to private equaty groups.

attributes.action: Ensure HIV treatment and support services receive the funding they need
attributes.background: HIV treatment and support services are vital for those who rely on them and for the wider public health of society. In the context of cuts to public health budgets, the Government must make provision to ensure that the integral role HIV services play is protected.

attributes.action: Link University Tuition Fees to the Hours Required for a Degree and Minimum Wage
attributes.background: Currently, university costs most full time students £9000, which for students aged 21+ would take them 1343 hours to earn and 1698 hours for 18-20 year olds on minimum wage, the rate a lot of students earn at. Whilst contact hours are variable across institutions, subjects and years of study ...
attributes.additional_details: the hours that are required to earn the degree are reasonably consistent and the vast majority of the time advertised at the beginning of the course. 100 hours of work, be it in lectures, completing assignments etc. are often required for 10 credits, and 120 credits are typically undertaken each year. We ask the government to link tuition fees to the hours of work put in and the minimum wage so that students are charged no more than they would earn on minimum wage working for the same duration.

attributes.action: Create UK specific symbol that represents visible and non-visible disabilities.
attributes.background: The International Symbol of Accessibility (ISA) - Wheelchair Symbol - is often confused being representative of all disabilities. This can, itself, cause discrimination for people with non-visible disabilities e.g. mental-ill health. A UK symbol to sit alongside the ISA would be a powerful message.
attributes.additional_details: Much has been learnt about symbolism and imagery. The UK are world leaders in addressing this in terms of equality. It would therefore be advantageous to make the final step to acknowledging all disabilities.. Paving the way for a future-proofed global emblem, coupled with positive communications tackling negative attitudes experienced by many when benchmarked against physical/visible conditions. Complimenting the current accessible symbol would start us down that path.

attributes.action: Allow dogs to visit consenting long staying patients in hospitals.
attributes.background: Research in America has demonstrated the uplifting effects experienced by both patients and staff when dogs are allowed to wander around hospital corridors and wards.
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs probably will not directly help a human to recover from illness, but dogs make humans happy. And feeling happy does make humans more likely to recover from illness.

The petitioner has been unable to find evidence of any diseases which are carried by dogs being transmitted to humans. 

How many diseases can you think of which a dog can transmit to a human during a hospital visit?

How many diseases can you think of which a human can transmit to a human during a hospital visit?

attributes.action: Amend handgun commandments that illegalize pistol firearms.
attributes.background: I want licensed gun owners to able own pistols as I find it strange how the government allows for the use of shotguns and hunting rifles, however, neglects the use of a smaller, less powerful, and  considerably cheaper firearm to purchase in comparison to a shotgun that can be very expensive

attributes.action: for the government to provide funding , equipment and the specialist staff
attributes.background: my wife died in st Thomas hospital in London i want the nhs to stop the practice of sending patients from kent to London.
attributes.additional_details: people in kent should be treated in there local hospitals and not sent to st Thomas in London,the government should provide funding,equipment and the specialist staff to hospitals in kent

attributes.action: Ban trucks and  commercial vehicle from roads at peak times
attributes.background: When I am commuting daily during office hours and school run, I see much of the traffic slowed down due to heavy vehicles like trucks. If they were asked not to run during 7.30 am -9.30 am and then between 3 pm -5 pm , I think it would go a long way in reducing the traffic congestion.

attributes.action: Censor and ban IS 'recruiting' websites
attributes.background:
Young people are influenced by things they see online - the glories of joining and supporting IS. The government needs to work harder to censor this material, keeping our children safe from recruiting websites.
Terrorism isn't just actions, it's a movement - this starts with ideas put into minds.

attributes.action: We want the government to set clear National guidance on the use of restraint.
attributes.background:
We want the government to set clear National guidance on the use of restraint on children and young people in schools and care facilities.
All special schools, residential facilities and mainstream schools (that use restraint) must also have sound recording CCTV were restraint is used.
attributes.additional_details: Children/young people with disabilities are being restrained and injured, my son has been both physically and mentally damaged through restraint and the Government must set clear guidance and standards to safeguard our children/young people.

attributes.action: Introduce tighter control of wild boar in the Forest of Dean
attributes.background: There is a lot of debate in the Forest of Dean with regards to wild boar which roam freely in the Forest and how they impact on our lives. Some people love them and some people don't. It is becoming more apparent the boar are causing a nuisance and are not just living deep in the Forest.
attributes.additional_details: Do we want tighter controls?

attributes.action: Commence an urgent review of the Child Maintenance Service Policies/Procedures.
attributes.background: The service levels offered by the Child Maintenance Service are exceptionally poor, staff are unhelpful and do not carry out instructions within reasonable timescales.  Also, the use of Gross Income in the calculations is unfair and takes no account of paying parents financial circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered from numerous issues created by this agency and am being financially disadvantaged by them and I am sure I am not alone.  Whilst the majority of paying parents have no issue paying maintenance, it is unfair and unjust that payments do not take into account the financial circumstances of either the paying or the receiving parent.
